name: officer
content:

B2 a person in the armed forces who has a position of authority: a naval officer a top-ranking officer
B1 a person who has a position of authority in an organization: a careers/customs/personnel officer
B1 a member of the police force: Two officers responded to the call at 282 Main Street. Officer Clarke [ as form of address ] "Do you know how fast you were driving, ma'am?" "No, officer."
More examplesFewer examplesThe officer commanded his men to shoot.Inasmuch as you are their commanding officer, you are responsible for the behaviour of these men.The police have appointed a liaison officer to work with the local community.Every available officer will be assigned to the investigation.There was a record number of confiscations by customs officers last year.
